solution_line_template: Each car in the garage has {wheels_per_car} wheels, for a total of {wheels_per_car}*{num_cars}=<<{wheels_per_car}*{num_cars}={car_wheels_total}>>{car_wheels_total} wheels.
The riding lawnmower has {wheels_lawnmower} wheels, bringing the total up to {car_wheels_total}+{wheels_lawnmower}={current_total_after_lawnmower} wheels.

The bicycles have {wheels_per_bicycle} wheels each and there are {num_bicycles} of them, for {num_bicycles}*{wheels_per_bicycle}={bicycle_wheels_total} wheels, bringing the total to {current_total_after_lawnmower}+{bicycle_wheels_total}= {current_total_after_bicycles}.

The tricycle has {wheels_per_tricycle} wheels, and the unicycle has {wheels_per_unicycle} wheel, bringing the total up to {current_total_after_bicycles}+{wheels_per_unicycle}+{wheels_per_tricycle}= {final_total_wheels} wheels
